Welcome to Dama’s documentation!¶

class Dama.main.Checkboard(player1, player2)¶

Class representing checkboard represent as matrix.

This class is basically interfrace for manipulating with pieces on checkboard itself. Each box on checkboard is represented by matrix thus number is as in matrix first y axis then x axis and indexing is from zero.

checkPlayerDefeat(checkboard, player)¶

Function which checks if player is defeated.

Player is defeat if either 1) has no active pieces on board 2) cannot move with any of his pieces.

Parameters:
  • checkboard (Checkboard) – context = checkboard on which the piece is placed.
  • player (Player) – player to check against.
Returns:

True if is defeat else otherwise.
Return type:

bool
getBoard(location)¶

Getter of self.board.

Parameters:location (Location) – lookup location.
Returns:returns Piece on board at specified location or None if there is none.
Return type:Piece
Raises:IndexError – If location is not on board.
move(player, move_dict)¶

Core function Checkboard, moves piece to specified location by move_dict.

move_dict must contain two keys: “start” and “end” which specifies starting and ending location of move.

Parameters:
  • player (Player) – player who is doing the move.
  • (dict (move_dict) – str:Location): Dictionary with keys “start” and “end” and their values of type Location
Returns:

piece which was moved

and location if an overleap occured
Return type:

(Piece, Location)
Raises:
  • ValueError – If there was problem with moving a piece because of ownership etc.
  • IndexError – If locations are out of bounds or end location is occupied etc.
class Dama.main.King(player, location)¶

Class representing single King on checkboard.

Implementation of Piece which represents King little bit overkill for such a small application but would be usefull for further scalability. Unlike Man, King can jump to any diagonal location.

canMoveTo(checkboard, end)¶

Implementation of Base class function canMoveFromTo

Checks if man can move/jump to specific location from start Care with usage of this function there is no checking of boundries
Parameters:
  • checkboard (Checkboard) – context = checkboard on which the piece is placed
  • end (Location) – end location of movement
Returns:

Returns if it is possible to move to location

Location is location of overleaped piece if exists
Return type:

bool, Location
Raises:
  • IndexError – If end location is not valid
  • ValueError – If move is not diagonal or direction is wrong
jumpPossible(checkboard)¶

Implementation of Base class function jumpPossible.

Function tries all possible jump location until it finds one possible or none.

Parameters:
  • checkboard (Checkboard) – context = checkboard on which the piece is placed
  • start (Location) – start location of jump
Returns:

location of possible jump else None.
Return type:

Location
movePossible(checkboard)¶

Implementation of Base class function movePossible.

Method which checks if piece can move to any location.

Parameters:checkboard (Checkboard) – context = checkboard on which the piece is placed.
Returns:location of possible move/jump.
Return type:Location
class Dama.main.Location(y, x)¶

Simple wrapper for location definition

y¶

y coordinate

Type:int
x¶

x coordinate

Type:int
isDiagonal()¶

Checks if location is diagonal eg. (1,-1) :returns: true if diagonal else otherwise :rtype: bool

isZero()¶

Checks if location is Zero eg. (0,0)

Returns:true if diagonal else otherwise
Return type:bool
normalized()¶

Creates and returns normalized location

Doesn’t make sense for non diagonal eg (4,4) -> (1,1), (-5,5) -> (-1,1)

Returns:normalized location
Return type:Location
class Dama.main.Man(player, location, y_direction=1)¶

Class representing single man on checkboard.

Implementation of Piece class and is little bit overkill for such a small application but would be usefull for further scalability. Man can only jump in 1 y axis diagonally and by one box at a time.

canMoveTo(checkboard, end)¶

Implementation of Base class function canMoveTo.

Function checks if it is possible to move/jump to end location Care with usage of this function there is no checking of boundries.

Parameters:
  • checkboard (Checkboard) – context = checkboard on which the piece is placed.
  • end (Location) – end location of movement.
Returns:

Returns location of overleaped piece if exists else None.

If move is not possible raises Error.
Return type:

Location
Raises:
  • IndexError – If end location is not valid.
  • ValueError – If move is not diagonal/too long or direction is wrong.
jumpPossible(checkboard)¶

Implementation of Base class function jumpPossible.

Function tries all possible jump location until it find one possible or none.

Parameters:
  • checkboard (Checkboard) – context = checkboard on which the piece is placed.
  • start (Location) – start location of jump.
Returns:

location of possible jump else None.
Return type:

Location
movePossible(checkboard)¶

Implementation of Base class function movePossible.

Method which checks if piece can move to any location.

Parameters:checkboard (Checkboard) – context = checkboard on which the piece is placed.
Returns:location of possible move/jump.
Return type:Location
class Dama.main.Piece(player, location)¶

Abstract Base class representing single piece on checkboard.

Piece is abstract class which serves as wrapper for checking possible moves. Piece is aware of its position board however when moving piece it has to be populated to Piece and Checkboard matrix(board).

player¶

owner of piece.

Type:Player
canMoveTo(checkboard, end)¶

Method which checks if piece can move to end location.

Care with usage of this function there is no checking of boundries.
Parameters:
  • checkboard (Checkboard) – context = checkboard on which the piece is placed.
  • end (Location) – end location of movement.
Returns:

Returns location of overleaped piece if exists else None.

If move is not possible raises Error.
Return type:

Location
Raises:
  • IndexError – If end location is not valid.
  • ValueError – If move is not diagonal/too long or direction is wrong.
getLocation()¶

Method for getting location of Piece on board

This method is basically getter for self._location and python decorators could be used in this place but this makes more sense from object perspective.

Returns:location of piece
Return type:Location
jumpPossible(checkboard)¶

Method which checks if piece can jump over enemey piece.

Parameters:checkboard (Checkboard) – context = checkboard on which the piece is placed.
Returns:location of possible jump, else None.
Return type:Location
movePossible(checkboard)¶

Method which checks if piece can move to any location.

Parameters:checkboard (Checkboard) – context = checkboard on which the piece is placed.
Returns:location of possible jump/move, else None
Return type:Location
moveTo(end)¶

Method for moving piece to specified location no checking.

This method is basically setter for self._location and python decorators could be used in this place but this makes more sense from object perspective.

Parameters:end (Location) – end location of movement.
Returns:None
class Dama.main.Player(name, upgrade_row, piece_chars)¶

Class for representing/storing data about player his active pieces.

active_pieces¶

Player’s pieces which are still in game.

Type:list
piece_chars¶

mapping from pice type to 1 character.

Type:dict
findJumpable(checkboard)¶

Function which finds first player’s piece that can jump.

Parameters:checkboard (Checkboard) – context = checkboard on which the piece is placed.

Returns Piece: first jumpable piece found else None.

findMoveable(checkboard)¶

Function which finds first player’s piece that can move/jump.

Parameters:checkboard (Checkboard) – context = checkboard on which the piece is placed.

Returns Piece: first moveable piece by non jumping found else None.

upgradableLocation(piece)¶

Function to check if piece in upgadable row.

Parameters:piece (Piece) – piece to be checked.
Dama.main.formatMove(move)¶

Simple function which formats user input Expected input is [a-zA-Z]d[a-zA-z]d with spaces anywhere.

Parameters:move (str) – input of user describing move.
Returns:
Location: dictionary with keys “start” and “end”.
and their respecitve location in range(checkboard_size-1, checkboard_size-1).
Return type:dict::str
Raises:ValueError – if format is wrong.
Dama.main.processMove(checkboard, player)¶

Function for getting user input and moving Piece.

Parameters:
  • checkboard (Checkboard) – context = checkboard on which the piece is placed.
  • player (Player) – player who is doing the move.
Returns:

None
Dama.main.startGame()¶

Function which setup and loops the game.

Current implementation setup game for two player who input their names and then game starts. White man is ‘x’, white king is ‘X’. Black man is ‘o’, black ing is ‘O’. First white piece is placed on A1 second on C1 etc. for first 3 rows. First black piece is placed on A8 second on C8 etc. for last 3 rows.

Returns:None
